getLocalNormal_tria6.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : getLocalNormal_tria6.c                                          *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Returns the unit normal[] vector at a local evaluation point given by L[]   *
00009 * that is interior to the element with global coordinates X[NODE][COORDINATE].*
00010 * Works for quadratic interpolation in triangular elements (6-noded triangles)*
00011 ******************************************************************************/
00012

00025 *                                                                             *

00035 
00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <stdlib.h>
00038 #include <math.h>
00039 
00040 int getLocalNormal_tria6(double *L, double X[6][3], double *normal)
00041 {
00042     double ax, ay, az, dx1, dx2, dy1, dy2, dz1, dz2, L1, L2, normalmod;
00043 
00044     /* Auxiliar quantities */
00045     L1 = L[0];
00046     L2 = L[1];
00047     ax = X[1][0] - X[3][0] + X[4][0] - X[5][0];
00048     ay = X[1][1] - X[3][1] + X[4][1] - X[5][1];
00049     az = X[1][2] - X[3][2] + X[4][2] - X[5][2];
00050 
00051     /* Derivatives of (x,y,z) with respect to L1 and L2 */
00052     dx1 = 4.0*(L1*(X[0][0] + X[4][0] - 2.0*X[5][0]) + L2*ax + X[5][0]) - X[0][0] - 3.0*X[4][0];
00053     dx2 = 4.0*(L1*ax + L2*(X[2][0] + X[4][0] - 2.0*X[3][0]) + X[3][0]) - X[2][0] - 3.0*X[4][0];
00054     dy1 = 4.0*(L1*(X[0][1] + X[4][1] - 2.0*X[5][1]) + L2*ay + X[5][1]) - X[0][1] - 3.0*X[4][1];
00055     dy2 = 4.0*(L1*ay + L2*(X[2][1] + X[4][1] - 2.0*X[3][1]) + X[3][1]) - X[2][1] - 3.0*X[4][1];
00056     dz1 = 4.0*(L1*(X[0][2] + X[4][2] - 2.0*X[5][2]) + L2*az + X[5][2]) - X[0][2] - 3.0*X[4][2];
00057     dz2 = 4.0*(L1*az + L2*(X[2][2] + X[4][2] - 2.0*X[3][2]) + X[3][2]) - X[2][2] - 3.0*X[4][2];
00058 
00059     /* Normal components and modulus (inverted) */
00060     normal[0] = dy1*dz2 - dy2*dz1;
00061     normal[1] = dx2*dz1 - dx1*dz2;
00062     normal[2] = dx1*dy2 - dx2*dy1;
00063     normalmod = 1.0/sqrt(normal[0]*normal[0] + normal[1]*normal[1] + normal[2]*normal[2]);
00064 
00065     /* Get unit normal */
00066     normal[0] = normal[0]*normalmod;
00067     normal[1] = normal[1]*normalmod;
00068     normal[2] = normal[2]*normalmod;
00069 
00070     return 0;
00071 }
